Header: Special Committee to amend the Electricity Act
Content: The government is mulling over the appointment of a special committee to amend the Electricity Act that has caused an Electricity crisis. A meeting was held between Minister Mahinda Amaraweera and the officials of the Ministry of Power. The committee has been appointed to amend the provisions of the Electricity Act which might hinder national electricity generation. Secretary of the Ministry of Power Wasanthaa Perera has been appointed as the Committee head. Mahinda Amaraweera stated that the construction of the new LNG power plant which was proposed to be completed by 2020 should commence immediately. It was also revealed that there is a possibility of an electricity crisis surfacing towards the middle of next year. A shortage of 100 Megawatts has occurred in the 2019-2020 period.
